name: U.S. Data Access Framework (DAF) DiagnosticReport Profile
publisher: Health Level Seven International (Infrastructure and Messaging - Data Access Framework)

element.name: DAFDiagnosticReport
element.definition: The scope is accessing a diagnostic report.
element.requirements: To support reporting for any diagnostic report into a clinical data repository.

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the url for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.
The base language in which the resource is written.

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

element.short: US Realm Laboratory Report Order Code
element.definition: The laboratory test, panel or battery that was ordered.

mapping.map: OBR-4-Universal Service ID (V2 doesn't provide an easy way to indicate both the ordered test and the performed panel)

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

element.name: USLabLOINCCoding
element.short: Code defined by a terminology system
element.definition: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.
element.requirements: Allows for translations and alternate encodings within a code system.  Also supports communication of the same instance to systems requiring different encodings.

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.
element.requirements: Need to be unambiguous about the source of the definition of the symbol.

element.short: Version of the system - if relevant
element.definition: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured. and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.

element.short: Symbol in syntax defined by the system
element.definition: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).
element.requirements: Need to refer to a particular code in the system.

element.definition: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.
element.requirements: Need to be able to carry a human-readable meaning of the code for readers that do not know  the system.

mapping.map: C*E.2 - but note this is not well followed

element.short: If this coding was chosen directly by the user
element.definition: Indicates that this coding was chosen by a user directly - i.e. off a pick list of available items (codes or displays).
element.requirements: This has been identified as a clinical safety criterium - that this exact system/code pair was chosen explicitly, rather than inferred by the system based on some rules or language processing.

mapping.map: fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:mapsTo dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:hasMap fhir:Coding.userSelected.map. fhir:Coding.userSelected.map a fhir:Map;   fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected\#true a [     fhir:source "true";     fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale\#O   ]

element.definition: This is the laboratory defined display text for the report if different from the code display text(s).
element.requirements: Used when the laboratory define how the dsplay text if different from the code display text.

mapping.map: C*E.9. But note many systems use C*E.2 for this

element.short: registered | partial | final | corrected | appended | cancelled | entered-in-error
element.definition: The status of the diagnostic report as a whole.
element.requirements: Diagnostic services routinely issue provisional/incomplete reports, and sometimes withdraw previously released reports.

binding.description: The status of the diagnostic report as a whole

mapping.map: statusCode  Note: final and amended are distinguished by whether observation is the subject of a ControlAct event of type "revise"

element.definition: The date and time that this version of the report was released from the source diagnostic service.
element.requirements: Clinicians need to be able to check the date that the report was released.

element.short: The subject of the report, usually, but not always, the patient
element.definition: The subject of the report. Usually, but not always, this is a patient. However diagnostic services also perform analyses on specimens collected from a variety of other sources.
element.requirements: SHALL know the subject context.

mapping.map: PID-3-Patient ID List (no V2 mapping for Group or Device)

element.definition: The diagnostic service that is responsible for issuing the report.
element.requirements: Need to know whom to contact if there are queries about the results. Also may need to track the source of reports for secondary data analysis.

element.short: Health care event when test ordered
element.definition: The link to the health care event (encounter) when the order was made.

element.short: Id for external references to this report
element.definition: The local ID assigned to the report by the order filler, usually by the Information System of the diagnostic service provider.
element.requirements: Need to know what identifier to use when making queries about this report from the source laboratory, and for linking to the report outside FHIR context.

mapping.map: OBR-51-Observation Group ID (todo: check semantic intent of OBR-51 with OOWG)

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
The purpose of this identifier.
element.requirements: Allows the appropriate identifier for a particular context of use to be selected from among a set of identifiers.

binding.description: Identifies the purpose for this identifier, if known

element.definition: A coded type for the identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.
element.requirements: Allows users to make use of identifiers when the identifier system is not known.

binding.description: A coded type for an identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose

element.definition: The URI for the laboratory Issuing the report.  This establishes the namespace in which set of possible id values is unique.
element.requirements: There are many sequences of identifiers.  To perform matching, we need to know what sequence we're dealing with. The system identifies a particular sequence or set of unique identifiers.
element.exampleUri: http://www.acme.com/identifiers/patient or urn:ietf:rfc:3986 if the id itself is a full uri

element.definition: The portion of the identifier typically displayed to the user and which is unique within the context of the system.

mapping.map: II.extension or II.root if system indicates OID or GUID (Or Role.id.extension or root)

element.short: Time period when id is/was valid for use
element.definition: Time period during which identifier is/was valid for use.

element.short: Organization that issued id (may be just text)
element.definition: Organization that issued/manages the identifier.

mapping.map: II.assigningAuthorityName but note that this is an improper use by the definition of the field.  Also Role.scoper

element.definition: Details concerning a test requested.
element.requirements: Need to be able to track completion of requests based on reports issued and also to report what diagnostic tests were requested (not always the same as what is delivered).

element.definition: The section of the diagnostic service that performs the examination e.g. biochemistry, hematology, MRI.
element.requirements: Help clinicians filter/find the reports they are looking for.

element.definition: This is the Specimen Collection Datetime or Period which is the physically relevent dateTime for laboratory tests.
element.requirements: Need to know where in the patient history to file/present this report.

element.short: Specimens this report is based on
element.definition: Details about the specimens on which this diagnostic report is based.
element.requirements: Need to be able to report information about the collected specimens on which the report is based.

element.short: Observations - simple, or complex nested groups
element.definition: Observations that are part of this diagnostic report. Observations can be simple name/value pairs (e.g. "atomic" results), or they can be grouping observations that include references to other members of the group (e.g. "panels").
element.requirements: Need to be able to individual results, or report groups of results, where the result grouping is arbitrary, but meaningful. This structure is recursive - observations can contain observations.

element.short: Reference to full details of imaging associated with the diagnostic report
element.definition: One or more links to full details of any imaging performed during the diagnostic investigation. Typically, this is imaging performed by DICOM enabled modalities, but this is not required. A fully enabled PACS viewer can use this information to provide views of the source images.

element.short: Key images associated with this report
element.definition: A list of key images associated with this report. The images are generally created during the diagnostic process, and may be directly of the patient, or of treated specimens (i.e. slides of interest).
element.requirements: Many diagnostic services include images in the report as part of their service.

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
A comment about the image. Typically, this is used to provide an explanation for why the image is included, or to draw the viewer's attention to important features.
element.requirements: The provider of the report should make a comment about each image included in the report.

element.definition: Reference to the image source.
Concise and clinically contextualized narrative interpretation of the diagnostic report.
element.requirements: Need to be able to provide a conclusion that is not lost amongst the basic result data.

element.definition: Codes for the conclusion.

binding.description: SNOMED CT findings codes provided as adjunct diagnosis to the report

element.definition: Rich text representation of the entire result as issued by the diagnostic service. Multiple formats are allowed but they SHALL be semantically equivalent.
element.requirements: Gives Laboratory the ability to provide its own fully formatted report for clinical fidelity.

element.name: DAFDiagnosticReport
element.definition: The scope is accessing a diagnostic report.

element.short: US Realm Laboratory Report Order Code
element.definition: The laboratory test, panel or battery that was ordered.
This is the laboratory defined display text for the report if different from the code display text(s).
element.requirements: Used when the laboratory define how the dsplay text if different from the code display text.

element.definition: The URI for the laboratory Issuing the report.  This establishes the namespace in which set of possible id values is unique.
This is the Specimen Collection Datetime or Period which is the physically relevent dateTime for laboratory tests.

binding.description: SNOMED CT findings codes provided as adjunct diagnosis to the report
